column4: I  have two files in different paths, one is a symlink of the other. Both have the same name. How do I know which is the symlink and which is the main file?
you can use ls -l to show what type of file each one is
the link will show like lrwxrwxrwx or so, depending on your permissions, the regular file will show as -rwxrwxrwx
